actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a single six-year term of office for the President and the Vice President, to provide that no Member of the House of Representatives may serve for more than three four-year terms, to provide that no Senator may serve for more than two terms, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Provides for a single six-year term for the offices of President and Vice President. Declares the term of office of a Representative to be four years, limited to no more than three terms. Limits Senators to two terms of office. Repeals the 22nd article of amendment to the Constitution.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a single six-year term of office for the President and the Vice President, to provide that no Member of the House of Representatives may serve for more than three four-year terms, to provide that no Senator may serve for more than two terms, and for other purposes.
